meanings.definition: A road or pedestrian passage that goes underneath another road or structure.
meanings.sent1: The children walked through the underpass to get to the park.
meanings.sent2: The underpass was dark and damp, but it provided a shortcut to the other side of the highway.
meanings.sent3: The underpass was so low that even the tallest person had to duck to avoid hitting their head.
meanings.sent4: The underpass was like a secret tunnel leading to a hidden world beneath the busy streets above.
meanings.sent5: The underpass echoed with the sound of footsteps, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To pass beneath something, such as a bridge or tunnel.
meanings.sent1: The train will underpass the river on its journey to the next town.
meanings.sent2: I had to underpass the highway to reach the other side of the city.
meanings.sent3: I tried to underpass the fallen tree by crawling underneath it, but it was too heavy to move.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to underpass his defenses, reaching straight to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's speed allowed him to underpass his opponents effortlessly, securing the victory.
